title: What kind of electric guitar did Paul McCartney use for 'Taxman'? - Quora

response.answer_text: Paul used a 1962 Epiphone Casino, a guitar that was crafted in Kalamazoo, MI in the Gibson guitar factory. I read that that Paul was inspired by Jimi Hendrix and how he used feedback; so he searched for a guitar that would easily feedback. With the Casino being a hollow body electric guitar, it reportedly achieved what he was looking for when he purchased it in late 1964. Paul’s Casino came with a Bigsby vibrato. George and John also each bought Epiphone Casinos soon after Paul. But their’s came with a different head stock (hour glass shape) than Paul’s (Gibson-style “open book” headstock). But George’s Casino also came with a Bigsby vibrato. (John’s came instead with a trapeze bridge.) One of his fave guitars, Paul played his Casino not only for the “Taxman” solo, but also for the “Paperback Rider” riff. All the Best!
